cab.content: Cjx$$$$. by the Secretary of State for India.From Viceroy, Foreign Department, 3rd May 1917. (Received at India Office 8.30 p.m.)Secret. Mahsuds. Our telegram of the 26th ultimo. On morning of 1st instant Mahsuds attacked convoy six miles from Nil-i-Kach. Our casualties: Captain G\ O. Everett, 67th Punjabis, and Lieutenant Savage, Indian Army Reserve of Officers, killed. Lieutenant R. L. Frost, 67th Punjabis, severely wounded. Indian casualties: Killed 49, wounded 50, missing 4. 79 rilles lost; full details not yet received. With convoy were 3 British officers, 4 Indian officers and 206 ranks. 67th Punjabis and 94th Infantry proceeding to Kajuri. Efforts are being made to intercept raiders.
